Original_Text: SAN FRANCISCO -- A leading tech firm announced a new AI-powered tool to enhance data security for enterprise clients, aiming to counter rising cyber threats.
NEW YORK -- A major retailer reported a 15 percent drop in quarterly profits due to supply chain disruptions and increased shipping costs.
LONDON -- A biotech startup secured $50 million in funding to develop a novel gene-editing therapy for rare diseases.
TOKYO -- A global electronics company unveiled a prototype for a foldable smartphone, intensifying competition in the mobile device market.
CHICAGO -- A pharmaceutical giant faced a setback after clinical trials for its new cancer drug failed to meet efficacy expectations.
HONG KONG -- A property developer reported record sales despite economic uncertainties, driven by demand for luxury apartments.
BERLIN -- Researchers developed a new solar panel technology that increases efficiency by 20 percent, promising cheaper renewable energy.
SYDNEY -- A mining companyâ€™s shares fell 8 percent after environmental concerns halted operations at a key site.
SEATTLE -- A cloud computing provider expanded its data centers to meet growing demand for remote work solutions.
PARIS -- A luxury goods conglomerate acquired a smaller competitor for $2 billion to strengthen its position in the European market.
